title: What are microplastics? - NOAA's National Ocean Service
body: Plastic is the most prevalent type of marine debris found in our ocean and Great Lakes. Plastic debris can come in all shapes and sizes, but those that are less than five millimeters in length (or about the size of a sesame seed) are called "microplastics.". As an emerging field of study, not a lot is known about microplastics and their ...
